channel.title: My brother cannot connect to my rsps
channel.description: Ok so I set up everything on my client and I went on canyouseeme.org and it said I was online so thats a relief. The thin is we are using the same wifi and idk what to put in the client.java and gui.java files instead of ¨127.0.0.1¨. When I replace it with my no-ip adress it says cannot connect to server. plz help me I cannot find the answer for this anywhere.

item.title: My brother cannot connect to my rsps
item.dc:creator: @XDZN-Scape_Bryan XDZN-Scape Bryan
item.description:
@XDZN-Scape_Bryan wrote:

pegasus358:

no it works now all I did was set up a himachi server and it worked fine

Yea, sorry i could’ve told you that you could’ve used hamachi, but i thought you were trying to portforward so a lot of people could join and not the max limit on an Hamachi server. Glad you figured it out!

Read full topic

item.title: My brother cannot connect to my rsps
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

Open start menu, click Run. Type in cmd, then type in ipconfig. I think it’s the IPv4 address but I’m not sure - the one that begins in 192.

Read full topic

item.source: My brother cannot connect to my rsps

item.title: My brother cannot connect to my rsps
item.dc:creator: @pegasus358 pegasus358
item.description:
@pegasus358 wrote:

AssassinsCRB:

I had this problem too, it didnt work with the no-ip or 127.0.0.1 because it was in the same ip so you need to use hamachi for this, get it on your comp set it up and create a network then join the network on your bros comp and then use the hamachi ip from the computer that hosts and put it in the client.

ok tyvm I got kinda confused with what you said but ill make sence of it ty so very much!

Read full topic
item.source: My brother cannot connect to my rsps

item.title: My brother cannot connect to my rsps
item.dc:creator: @AssassinsCRB AssassinsCRB
item.description:
@AssassinsCRB wrote:

I had this problem too, it didnt work with the no-ip or 127.0.0.1 because it was in the same ip so you need to use hamachi for this, get it on your comp set it up and create a network then join the network on your bros comp and then use the hamachi ip from the computer that hosts and put it in the client.

Read full topic
item.source: My brother cannot connect to my rsps

item.title: My brother cannot connect to my rsps
item.dc:creator: @pegasus358 pegasus358
item.description:
@pegasus358 wrote:

[quote=“XDZN-Scape Bryan, post:4, topic:461984”]Ok, first - did you port forward it correctly? And if you did port forward it correctly then if you and your brother are using different computers you need to give your brother the client that has the (port forwarded IP in the client.java and GUI.java) and for your computer you need to have it as YOUR main ip that you used into the port forwarding process. ALSO when running the server make sure the port forwarding is online and working.

If this doesn’t work or help, let me know what client and source your using (like a 317, 508, etc) so I can figure it out.

good luck hope it works, if not ill try my best to figure it out![/quote]
first of all tyvm for responding. I am 100% sure I portforwarded correctly. So basically I use the 127.0.0.1, my real ip or my no-ip. And my brother needs to use my real ip or my no-ip? my client is 317 PI.

Read full topic
item.source: My brother cannot connect to my rsps

item.title: My brother cannot connect to my rsps
item.dc:creator: @XDZN-Scape_Bryan XDZN-Scape Bryan
item.description:
@XDZN-Scape_Bryan wrote:

Ok, first - did you port forward it correctly? And if you did port forward it correctly then if you and your brother are using different computers you need to give your brother the client that has the (port forwarded IP in the client.java and GUI.java) and for your computer you need to have it as YOUR main ip that you used into the port forwarding process. ALSO when running the server make sure the port forwarding is online and working.

If this doesn’t work or help, let me know what client and source your using (like a 317, 508, etc) so I can figure it out.

good luck hope it works, if not ill try my best to figure it out!

Read full topic
